title: Installation issue: llvm
body:
Hi,

Trying to do `spack install llvm` on a Mac (Catalina) I got : 

```
==> Installing llvm-11.0.0-gpecd63u5gvd4mhbq3gibgvxjtsucwrq
==> No binary for llvm-11.0.0-gpecd63u5gvd4mhbq3gibgvxjtsucwrq found: installing from source
/Users/laurent/github.com/spack/spack/lib/spack/spack/architecture.py:203: UserWarning: microarchitecture specific optimizations are not supported yet on mixed compiler toolchains [check clang@11.0.3-apple for further details]
  warnings.warn(msg.format(compiler))
==> Error: UnsupportedCompilerFlag: clang (< 3.3) does not support the C++11 standard (as compiler.cxx11_flag).
    If you think it should, please edit the compiler.clang subclass to implement the cxx11_flag property and submit a pull request or issue.

/Users/laurent/github.com/spack/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/llvm/package.py:357, in setup_build_environment:
        356    def setup_build_environment(self, env):
  >>    357        env.append_flags("CXXFLAGS", self.compiler.cxx11_flag)
```

If I understand correctly the error is already happening in the "recipe" (package.py), so I don't have build logs to provide ?

```
> spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.16.0-121-32e23f532
* **Python:** 3.8.5
* **Platform:** darwin-catalina-skylake
* **Concretizer:** original
```

@naromero77  @trws

Might well be a stupid error from my side, but cannot pinpoint it...
